sen.j: 深草少将（ふかくさのしょうしょう）は、室町時代に世阿弥ら能作者が創作した、小野小町にまつわる「百夜通い」の伝説に登場する人物。
sen.e: FUKAKUSA no Shosho is a character who appears in a legend concerning ONO no Komachi, 'Come-and-go in a Hundred Nights,' which was created by Noh writers such as Zeami during the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 欣浄寺の池の横には「少将の通い道」とよばれるものがあり、訴訟を持っている者がここを通るとかなわないと言われる。
sen.e: By the pond in the Gonjo-ji Temple there is a 'path Shosho walked,' and tradition has it that if those who are in litigation walk the path, they will lose their cases.

sen.j: 小野小町を愛したといわれ、小町が私の元へ百日間通い続けたら結婚しようと言い、九十九夜通ったが、雪の降る日で、雪に埋まり凍死したとも言われている。
sen.e: It is said that he loved ONO no Komachi, and she told him that if he kept visiting her for hundred days, she would marry him, but on a snowy day, the ninety-ninth night, he froze to death under the snow.
